intro: Macoubea sinuosa, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its unique, zigzagging stems that give it its common name. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a slightly waxy texture. Macoubea sinuosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
